alert.note: Alert for Muskogee; Wagoner (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 5:04PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Wagoner, northeastern Okmulgee, northwestern Muskogee and southeastern Tulsa Counties through 545 PM CDT... At 504 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 5 miles north of Broken Arrow to 2 miles west of Taft. Movement was northwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations in or near the path include... Tulsa... Broken Arrow... Muskogee... Bixby... Coweta... Haskell... Porter... Taft... Stonebluff... Oneta... Redbird... Jamesville... Leonard... Choska... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 225 and 227. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
